resources.string: Permissions over storage are needed in order to run this task
Please, select the file to sign

Welcome to the "Autofirma App"\nThis application allows making electronic signatures from compatible service providers Web pages.\nTo use the app, you\'ll need an electronic certificate and its related private key installed on the device. Consult the Android documentation and your service provider\'s documentation.
Please select the certification authority for requesting your new certificate.
There are not configured certification authorities
Illegal App invocation, please ask the entity in charge of the process.
Error trying to send back the signature to the Web page.
Error trying to load the file \"%s\"
The use of NFC has been cancelled. The system store will be used
An error occurred loading the signature data
The file \"%s\" is not a valid PKCS#12. Please, select another store for importing.
Error trying to save the signature
There was an error trying to send back the data to the Web browser
The signing certificate cannot be readed
Error gathering the certificate aliases from the key store
The Signature Client does not have disk write permissions.
The Signature Client does not have disk read permissions.
The target folder for saving the signature is missing
There are no certificates installed on the device.
Your smart card is locked. Please contact the issuer for more information.
The PDF password cannot be empty:
Error: The smart card PIN is empty or null.
Android 4.1 and 4.1.1 versions do not allow special characters on certificate aliases. Please, change the name avoiding special characters.
Enter your CAN code to establish an NFC connection with your DNIe.
Resultado de firma: Failed to sign
The signature could not be completed, please, try again later.
The signature "%1$s" was saved on the same folder as the original file.
The signature "%1$s" was saved on the donwloads folder.
Wrong PIN. Please, beware that invalid PIN entering can lock your smart card.
The selected file is too large and there is no enough memory to load it
Bring your device closer to the DNIe
Place the device on the DNIe and do not move it during the signing operation
Please activate NFC to use DNIe and press back to return
Your device has been detected as having NFC. Do you want to enable it to sign with the DNIe via NFC?
NFC has not been enabled. The system store will be used.
The use of NFC has been cancelled. The system store will be used.
CAN cannot be empty or null
Error starting connection to card. Please try again.
Allow the use of DNIe by NFC
The domain \"%s\" has an incorrect format.
Use asterisk (*) at the beginning or end as wildcard.
Enter your CAN code to establish an NFC connection with your DNIe. The CAN code contains six digits and can be found in the lower right corner of your DNI
Sign documents enclosed and legally identifying you with your digital certificate or electonic ID.
Locate .p12 or .pfx file. on your phone
If you can\'t find it, send it to your mobile from another device via email or other cloud applications.
We haven\'t been able to add your certificate to the AutoSignature app correctly. Try again later
The file has been signed correctly.
With what do you sign the file?

This application enables electronic signatures to be made on the pages of service providers supporting it. To work properly, you must install an electronic certificate. Check your Android system documentation and with your certification service provider.
Load your certificate on your device or in the cloud. Impair it through the "Add Certificate" option of the application.
Allowed extensions: .p12 and .pfx. Remember that you need the export password for your certificate, and that it must include the private key.
How can I make electronic signatures with this program?

string.name: response_1
string.p: AutoFirma App Android allows you to sign with your certified web formalities compatible with the application.

To sign a formality, please fill it normally through your web browser. If the procedure is ready for signature with AutoSigning App, it will be executed at the time of signature for the user to select their certificate and run the operation.
Remember that before starting the procedure you must have imported your signature certificate in AutoSigning App.

resources.string: Signing some web formalities fail, while that same procedure works on other devices. Why?

AutoFirm App still lacks certain features that are present in versions for other operating systems. Future product updates will address these shortcomings. In the meantime, use another system and notify the person responsible for the web process if they deem it necessary.
Are my certificates at risk if I lose the device?

The certificates are stored on your device with a powerful password protected encryption, but like any cryptographic system, at the time it is out of control of the owner is at risk of being compromised. If you lose the device you should contact your certification service provider as soon as possible to immediately revoke the certificates it contained.
I imported the certificates correctly in AutoFirm App, but I still can\'t identify with them in the electronic venues and other web pages that require it Why?

Certificates imported into AutoFirm App are for exclusive use for electronic signatures on web pages designed for that purpose. To use a digital certificate in a secure Web authentication you must follow the instructions of your Web browser and Android regarding the process of installing the certificates and their keys in the Android OS and in the Web browser itself if necessary.

I have read and agree to the Privacy Policy
I have read and agree with the Legal Notice and the Terms and Conditions of Use
To identify yourself using DNIe, you need to have an electronic ID with certificates in effect and know the PIN code.
Enter the CAN of the DNI
The CAN is a number located at the bottom right of the ID. It is necessary for ID reading with NFC.
When you get the DNIe you received a PIN code that you can retrieve or change in police stations without appointment.
Place your DNIe on a smooth surface and place your mobile without cover on it until it detects the chip.
Place your mobile over the DNIe as close as possible to the NFC reader.
No certificate installed in the system has been found or not selected to make the signature.
Enter in the next section the trusted domains for the application
Enter one or more trusted domains
The certificate is invalid as it is expired.
The chosen certificate is a pseudonym certificate. Your personal data will not appear in the firm.
